intro: Archangelica tschimganica, commonly known as the Tschimganica angelica, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its tall, branched stems and large, compound leaves. It is native to Central Asia and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. Its aromatic leaves and roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. However, it is important to note that the plant contains toxic compounds and should be handled with care.
